Detailed Description

Dealing with versioning.

Description

This abstract class is used for creating and dissecting version number, particually from Version() and Since() that all CM classes use.

Usage

See the examples below.

Example

A common example is to make sure the class is at least a given version: 

 if(CMVersion::MakeVersion(CMFileVCF::Version()) < CMVersion::MakeVersion("1.0.3"))
   die("Sorry, you need at least v1.0.3 of CMFileVCF");

The same example above can be written simpler with: 

 if(CMVersion::AtLeast(CMFileVCF::Version(), "1.0.3"))
   die("Sorry, you need at least v1.0.3 of CMFileVCF");
Author:
Elliot Chance

static AtLeast ( $  version1,
$  version2 
) [static]

Check if one version is greater or equal to than another.

$version1 and $version2 will automatically be determined to be numerical or string versions and calculated as needed.

Parameters:
$version1 Numerical or string value of the version.
$version2 Numerical or string value of the version.
Returns:
true if $version2 is greater than OR equal to $version1.

Definition at line 85 of file CMVersion.php.

static MakeVersion ( $  versionString  )  [static]

Translate a string version into a numerical version.

Versions are in the form of MAJOR.MINOR.REVISION where the REVSISION can be ommited and have a value of 0. The MAJOR, MINOR and REVISION each have a respective weight of 1000000, 1000 and 1 respectivly. So the following versions get calculated as follows:

 1.0.0   -> 1000000
 1.23.34 -> 1023034
 2.5     -> 2005000
Warning:
As this is a purely methematical function, if a version if given in an unacceptable format it may return unexpected or illogical results.
Parameters:
$versionString The version string in the form of MAJOR.MINOR.REVISION or MAJOR.MINOR.
Returns:
Numerical value of the version.
